Romaneira
one of largest Quintas in region, with a total of 412 hectares and more than 3 kilometers riverfront on Douro river.  Vines were planted in terraces on steep slopes of the property: with many valleys and headlands,

Romaneira contains several microclimates and several slopes facing south, southeast and southwest.  
The resulting diversity means that ‚ÄúSingle Quinta‚Äù wines from Romaneira are produced from grapes from a complex mixture of sites.

Renewed vintage, now 2019, of this always good Portuguese blend from the Douro, mix of Touriga Franca, TN, Tinta Roriz, Tinta C√£o and Syrah! Intense aromas, lots of ripe fruit, sweet spices, fine herbs, cocoa and a floral background! Silky and round wine!

Safra renovada, agora 2019, desse sempre bom blend portugu√™s do Douro, mix de Touriga Franca, TN, Tinta Roriz, Tinta C√£o e Syrah! Aromas intensos, muita fruta madura, especiarias doces, ervas finas, cacau e um fundo floral! Vinho aveludado e redondo!

3,9 stars. What a delicious inexpensive blend of Touriga Nacional & Franca, Tinta Roriz, Tinto Cao & Syrah! Superb cooled down with food.

Romaneira
one of largest Quintas in region, with a total of 412 hectares and more than 3 kilometers riverfront on Douro river.  Vines were planted in terraces on steep slopes of the property: with many valleys and headlands,

Romaneira contains several microclimates and several slopes facing south, southeast and southwest.  
The resulting diversity means that ‚ÄúSingle Quinta‚Äù wines from Romaneira are produced from grapes from a complex mixture of sites.

Decant it first for 30 min if you can. Serve it between 14-16 Celsius degrees. Dark berries and black olives on the nose. Firm but polished tannins, medium to long aftertaste. Paired with a Portuguese "Aroo de paro", Very good! I gave it 91/100.
Light. Purple coloured red wine with an elegant energetic nose thanks to the pepper and other spices. Grapes grown on granite soil.

Another Dao with lovely balanced acidity and gentle fruit. Not immediately fruity, but a lush dark crimson colour and a pleasing nose makes this another Dao to savour. Should be around ¬£10 in my opinion.

Bought this to go with a simple saturday steak lunch. And it turned out to be a great choice! On the nose a promising savoury aroma. Lots of herbs, spices and toasted oak. On the palate more of the same, with a nice blackcurrant rich fruitiness and salty licorice to accompany the flavour profile and a very good acidity and mouthfeel that makes this a perfect food wine. Lots of flavour and concentration here. And for the price this is a very good buy.

Dark ruby colour, heavy uniform tear on the glass. Scent of green apple and ceddar wood. Taste of ripe plums and forest berries. Smooth and long aftertaste. Excellent balance and slightly adstringent. Goes very well with roast lamb, smoked meat, pasty sheep cheese and to drink with no food in a moment of good company.

I found this wine really impressed and showed good versatility across a tasting menu enjoyed at Portland restaurant, London. Fruity aromas of black cherry in particular on the nose, but also pleasant elements of chocolate, cedar and maybe even black olive. Good acidity and well-integrated tannins. A steal at ¬£35/bottle restaurant price, and I would imagine a lot less off-trade

Aromas of ripe red fruit and wet earth. Good acidity soft smooth tannins low alcohol, well balanced and quite elegant. Tried the 2016 vintage and was surprised by the colour, this dark ruby with deep purple highlights. Note that even for a 6 years old wine, it was not very leggy. It is a dry wine, no doubt, with aromas of blackcurrant and black cherry, a bit of tobacco too, but not very pungent. The mouthful was pleasant, not too strong on the tannins, medium bodied I found it. 
All in all, a decent wine, was probably expecting more depth of flavour for this vintage. 
Paired it with slow roasted lamb for Easter roast.

Just arrived in Portugal.  Great wine to start the visit. Smooth with oak, vanilla, and dark chocolate notes throughout.  It starts a little juicy and gets just a touch more dry through the finish.

Seven varieties: Aragonez, Trincadeira, Syrah, Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Cabernet Sauvignon, Alicante Bouschet. 12 mooin oak (French, American 60:40). Deep ruby. Clean, medium plus intensity aroma of black fruit, coffee, tobacco, earth and orange peel. Dry, medium plus acidity, medium plus ripe tannins, high alcohol, full body and medium plus finish. Palate confirms the nose. Intense, bold, complex. WOP.

Smooth and balanced. Medium to full-bodied, medium tannins and acidity. Stone, leather, plum, cranberry and cherry on the nose. Palate: vanilla, plum, cherry, earthy, pepper. Long and smooth finish. Requires some time to oxidate after opening.

In the mouth it‚Äôs dry, flavors of black fruits, blackberries, notes of  coffee, chocolate, spices and a slight toast from the barrel. Well-structured, with a long and persistent finish.

Mild well-used oak shows through a subtle vanilla hints. Velvety medium tannins, high acidity, medium(+) body and a medium(+) finish.

Didn‚Äôt disappoint. Lots of black fruit on the nose, BlackBerry, plum, blueberry. Taste was fruit forward with the aforementioned, with the tannins and boldness to follow of oak and a little leather. Softer finish of vanilla. Finish wasn‚Äôt overly long but overall a pleasant red wine.

Took this 1991 Espor√£o Reserva out from the cellar and into a night with friends and petiscos - and what a beautiful surprise. Although I felt it was a couple of years past its prime, loved the balance and complexity - on the nose, all balsamic, earthy, cigar box and some toffee, tawny-like notes. It needs some time to open, but then it‚Äôs great! Dark ruby color and intensely aromatic: cherry jelly, balsamic notes, cedar, spices (nutmeg and sandalwood), chocolate, mint, resins and flowers. Deep purple colour. Gorgeous floral bouquet of plum, vanilla, leather, and cherry. Layered palate of plum, dark berries, leather, and tobacco. Medium bodied with light, well mannered tannins. Paired well with Peranakan food which has spices and full of favours. Full bodied and yet not over powering with combination of different grape types in balance. Quite a good recommendation by the owner of the restaurant.

Good wine to get me ready for a trip to Douro Valley this week!  This wine is fairly big and bold. Good balance of fruit and tannins. Very jammy. Can't wait to see what else Douro has in store for me and my friends.

Strongly divided opinions - more than any wine. 4 stars from me. 1.5 from Annie. Intense nose of black currant, dark fruit and leather with liquorice and something lighter-mint perhaps. The amount of Cabernet Sauvignon they used to apply in the blend still saved it from the certain death, so you have some fun drinking it! The taste of dried roses the hint of old dark chocolate and spices from last century, allows you to imagine this wine when it was still willing to live and pleasure your palate... God by my friend, don't fall to hard...
